hints.content:
All of the figures show $\dfrac56$ shaded.  

However, for two fractions to be equivalent, they must refer to the same size whole.
Which answer choice shows $\dfrac56$ of the same size wholes shaded?

This pair of figures shows equivalent areas shaded:



[[☃ image 1]]

$=$

[[☃ image 2]]

options.alt: Two identical shapes equal in size. They are separated by an equal sign. The top shape is divided into 6 equal parts. 5 of the parts are shaded. The bottom shape is divided into 6 equal parts. 5 of the parts are shaded. !

Two identical shapes equal in size. They are separated by an equal sign. The top shape is divided into 6 equal parts. 5 of the parts are shaded. The bottom shape is divided into 6 equal parts. 5 of the parts are shaded. !

question.content:
**Which pair of figures have equivalent areas shaded?**


[[☃ radio 1]]
